title: Will Windows 10 and League of Legends be Friends?
body:
***8/7/2015 UPDATE:***  We have heard many reports of players having issues with AMD Graphics Cards with the HD 6000 series and older.  From digging into this deeper, AMD have put out the following information regarding their hardware:

> ***Will my graphics adapter work in Windows® 10 if it does not support DirectX® 12?***
 
> AMD Radeon™ HD 5000 and AMD Radeon™ HD 6000 Series products should fully work in Windows® 10 but will not support DirectX® 12 specific features.  AMD is working closely with Microsoft® to have certified graphics drivers available for these products when Windows® 10 officially launches.

> AMD Radeon™ HD 4000 Series or older products are not certified to support Windows Display Driver Model (WDDM) 1.2 or later.  Therefore, systems using AMD Radeon™ HD 4000 Series or older will default to running the Microsoft® Basic Display Driver.  As a result, display functionality may be limited.
 
> If your graphics adapter is based on an AMD Radeon™ HD 4000 Series or older, you may consider these options:

> 1) Upgrade to an AMD graphics card on the support product list.

> 2) Continue using the existing operating system.

> ***Source:*** https://community.amd.com/docs/DOC-1311

---------------------------------------------

Hey all,

The answer is yes!  We have been been extensively testing Windows 10 here at Riot, and we will be fully supporting Windows 10.  If you haven’t heard already, you will be able to freely upgrade to Windows 10 as long as you have [Windows 7 or 8.1 (8 users need to update to 8.1) ](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Windows_10#Upgrade_compatibility) already installed. If you do decide to upgrade, here is what you need to know:

* Make sure to check whether your computer meets the [requirements for Windows 10](http://www.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/windows-10-specifications)

* If you do update, Windows 10 ***should*** download all the necessary updates or latest drivers for your hardware automatically.  If you do have problems afterwards, you may need to contact your computer manufacturer (Dell, HP, etc) or your hardware manufacturer (MSI, Gigabyte, Nvidia, AMD, etc) to manually download the latest updates or drivers. Since it was just released, some manufacturers may not have updated drivers/updates ready

***NOTE:  Older hardware not directly supported by its own manufacturers anymore may not have new drivers for Windows 10.***

* Make sure to play a Custom Game first after updating to make sure everything works normally!   You don’t want to be in a Ranked Game if suddenly your mouse stops working

* If you encounter any problems with League of Legends immediately after upgrading to Windows 10, make sure to [run a repair first](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/202969434-Patching-Issues#wq6), to see if it resolves any problems.  If not, try completing a [full and clean re-installation](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/202539040-Reinstalling-League-of-Legends) as well.

* If all else fails, make sure to [submit a ticket!](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) This way we can easily track any compatibility issues that may occur with Windows 10. Make sure to include the following in your ticket as well:

 * [DxDiag](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs#wq5)

 * [Your latest R3d Log if you were able to play a game on Windows 10](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs#wq7)

 * [Process List](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs#wq3)

-------------------------------------------------------------------

Lastly, if you are experiencing any issues, make a post with the following information filled out:

Operating System: Windows 10
Graphics Card: 
CPU:

replies.body:
For players experiencing issues with the client appearing as a black screen right after login, please try this temporary workaround.

1) Right click the League of Legends Launcher
2) Select the Properties option on the dropdown menu
3) Click on the Compatibility Tab
4) Check the “Disable Display Scaling on High DPI Settings” box
5) Then, Check the “Run as Administrator” box.
6) Click Apply.
7) Launch the game.
My problem is getting a black screen at the log-in screen, i can hear the sounds and music but it's just a black box, i tried all of the above options and even re-downloaded the game but to no avail

The Fix for the black screen: Right click League of Legends -> Properties -> Compatibility. Uncheck compatibility mode, check "Disable display scaling on high DPI settings", check "Run this program as an administrator".
 {{champion:17}}
I used this and the information above from Riot. I'm still having the same issue.

Hi ,SO the problem that i got for the moment is that as soon as i got Windows 10 i lost all my fps(i was running with 50/80fps) and i got a blackscreen sometimes on the loading screen (Your com' didn't help me but thanks i did step by step but it didn't help me at  all) If you can help me with my problem it would be great ! Bye !

This honestly seems like there might be a problem with Windows 10 and the currently drivers for your Graphics Card you have installed.  Check to make sure that you have the latest drivers installed for Windows 10!

If you do, reply back and attach your [DxDiag](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs#wq5) and your [latest R3d log](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs#wq7) so that we can take a bit of a deeper look!

I am having the same issue in game..>I guess I"m around 10 fps or less but I can't find where to see it on the new UI.  Occasional flashes of black screen. I"m going to check my drivers and report back but that is what I"m at atm.

Ok so what I ended up doing was going to my graphics drivers.  Windows updated both the default chipset and my Nvidia graphics card drivers and they were both trying to run causing issues.  I disabled the chipset and the problem was solved.
How do you disable the chipset?

I am getting random crashing in League of Legends ever since I have updated to Windows 10.

I have an AMD graphics card (Radeon 7990), with an Intel CPU (3570K).

I've tried all the currently available AMD drivers, including the new beta driver released yesterday but the crashing persists.  I've also tried running the game in various compatibility modes, but nothing seems to help.  League of Legends is the only game I am having issues with.

This morning I upgraded to W10 and tried to launch lol as soon as it was done. And when I tried to log in after the "logging in" message, a "Unable to connect to the PvP.net server" appeared. I already tried all the possible options that the link in the message gives.

Operating System: Windows 10
Graphics Card: Intel(R) HD Graphics 4000
CPU: Intel Core i5 3317U

Also this appeared "The program cannot start because "Msvcr100.dll" is missing from your computer. Try reinstalling again to fix this problem" The same happened with "Msvcp100.dll" I already tried reinstalling the game with no luck so far.
I had the same problem and i tried everything in forums to fix it. I ended up going from windows 10 back to windows 8.1 Then i logged into LOL and it worked.{{item:3074}}
if a Dll is missing its directX missing

I had a problem where it said pvp.kernel is not responding or something like that and all i did was run as administrator, and it worked.

I cannot run League on borderless windowed mode, pls help! Thank you!

OS: Win 10 Home Premium, 64 Bit,
GPU: Nvidia GTX 970,
CPU: Intel i5 3570K

When you select Windowed mode, you see "Fullscreen" and "Windowed" I assume?
Use your mouse to scroll down to select Windowed Mode while those 2 options are preset. Same thing when selecting the resolution - scroll up.
Don't forget to uncheck compatibility mode! =) fixed the problem. Hope this helps!{{champion:84}}

A recent windows 10 automatic update disconnected me from a ranked team game. Is there a way to cancel windows 10 automatic updates?

> [{quoted}](name=AtomicBetty69,realm=OCE,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=AnR7gUle,comment-id=0059,timestamp=2015-11-06T13:28:27.485+0000)
>
> A recent windows 10 automatic update disconnected me from a ranked team game. Is there a way to cancel windows 10 automatic updates?

Hit the windows icon, go to settings, go to update & security, and set your own scheduled update times. I set mine to 5 am, as that is when I am not playing.
